title: Manhattan DA Expected to Ask Judge to Exonerate Two Men Convicted in Killing of Malcolm X
sub_head: Muhammad A. Aziz and Khalil Islam spent years behind bars until a Netflix documentary sparked a review by the district attorney
body:
The Manhattan district attorneyâ€™s office on Thursday plans to ask a New York state judge to toss the convictions of two men found guilty of the 1965 assassination of Malcolm X.
Vacating the convictions would lead to the exonerations of Muhammad A. Aziz and Khalil Islam, who spent years in prison for the killing.
